thread.title: Birmingham's Smylie Kaufman charges to $1.1 million PGA Tour victory
thread.title_full: Birmingham's Smylie Kaufman charges to $1.1 million PGA Tour victory | AL.com

author: Mark Inabinett | minabinett@al.com
title: Birmingham's Smylie Kaufman charges to $1.1 million PGA Tour victory
text:
Birmingham native Smylie Kaufman captured his first PGA Tour victory in his fifth start on the circuit. Kaufman won the Shriners Hospitals for Children Open in Las Vegas with a fourth-round charge on Sunday.
Kaufman carded a 10-under-par 61 in the final round, a charge from the rear that left him waiting more than two hours for the rest of the field to finish. He had an eagle and seven birdies in the last 11 holes of the tournament to finish at 16-under 268 at TPC Summerlin.
Kaufman, 23, finished one stroke ahead of six golfers, including former Alabama standout Jason Bohn.
The victory earned Kaufman the $1,152,000 first prize and secured spots in the 2016 Masters, Players Championship and PGA Championship.
The Shriners Hospitals for Children Open was the second stop on the PGA Tour's 2015-16 schedule. Kaufman finished tied for 10 th in the opening event, the Frys.com Open, last week. Kaufman earned his PGA Tour card for this season by finishing sixth on the money list for the Web.com Tour last season.
Kaufman was a golf standout at Vestavia Hills High School, where he also played basketball, helping the Rebels take the AHSAA Class 6A championship in 2009. Kaufman played collegiate golf at LSU.
